dmTitle.infoName: Default business rules exchange data module

levelledPara.title: Converter/Cartridge Assembly
levelledPara.para: The converter/cartridge assembly (CNV-365B) is where the chemical conversion process takes place. The converter/cartridge assembly consists of a pressure vessel and two catalyst cartridges. The pressure vessel is a stainless steel cylinder supported by a two-point mount located at its base and a third hinge-pinned connection mount to the adjacent recycle heater assembly. This configuration allows the converter assembly the freedom of movement due to thermal expansion, shock, and vibration loads. The pressure vessel cover is held in place by 14 tee bolts and nuts. The cover also contains a lifting eye to facilitate cover removal. A sealing groove for a carbon filled flexible stainless steel compression gasket is used to seal the cover to the pressure vessel. Inlet and outlet piping is one inch stainless steel.

The upper (CAT-367B) and lower (CAT-366B) cartridges are cylindrical canisters approximately 14 inches long and eight inches in diameter. Each cartridge is packed with approximately 500 cubic inches of catalyst (23 lb). The canister cover is initially spring loaded to 73 lb to compensate for catalyst bed depletion (the catalyst slowly disintegrates). The spring retainer incorporates a handle to facilitate cartridge replacement. The bottom of each cartridge contains a floating metal seal to prevent a significant amount of recycle gas from bypassing the cartridge catalyst bed. The recycle gas flow is axial, entering the bottom and exiting the top of the tandem cartridges.
